intro: Hybanthus teucriifolius, commonly known as the silverleaf hybanthus, is a flowering plant native to South America. It is a member of the Solanaceae family, which includes nightshades, and is characterized by its small, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows as an annual herb with hairy, lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in a fine silvery down. Its flowers are usually pale blue to purple in color and are arranged in clusters at the ends of the stems. Hybanthus teucriifolius is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in a variety of environmental conditions.
